feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [topthink/framework] ThinkPHP Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability
entry.content:
A Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability exists in ThinkPHP 3.x.x via value[_filename] in index.php, which could let a malicious user obtain server control privileges.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44892
  • https://github.com/Stakcery/Web-Security/issues/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-75jp-87w2-c6x2

entry.title: [topthink/framework] ThinkPHP5 SQL Injection vulnerability
entry.content:
SQL Injection vulnerability exists in ThinkPHP5 5.0.x <=5.1.22 via the parseOrder function in Builder.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44350
  • https://github.com/top-think/framework/issues/2613
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q868-c4vw-qjx3

entry.title: [topthink/framework] ThinkPHP SQL injection vulnerability
entry.content:
In ThinkPHP 5.1.24, the inner function delete can be used for SQL injection when its WHERE condition's value can be controlled by a user's request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-17566
  • https://github.com/top-think/think/issues/858
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-75fm-52mm-q5rm

entry.title: [topthink/framework] thinkphp SQL Injection via the index.php s parameter
entry.content:
thinkphp 3.1.3 has SQL Injection via the index.php s parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-10225
  • http://www.blcat.cn/post-39.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xvhr-7q4q-qjgp

entry.title: [smarty/smarty] Smarty PHP code injection
entry.content:
Smarty 3 before 3.1.32 is vulnerable to a PHP code injection when calling fetch() or display() functions on custom resources that does not sanitize template name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000480
  • https://github.com/smarty-php/smarty/blob/master/change_log.txt
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/01/msg00023.html
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/02/msg00000.html
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4094
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9m49-vhwv-422g

entry.title: [smarty/smarty] Smarty arbitrary PHP code execution
entry.content:
Smarty before 3.1.21 allows remote attackers to bypass the secure mode restrictions and execute arbitrary PHP code as demonstrated by "{literal}<{/literal}script language=php>" in a template.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-8350
  • https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=765920
  • https://code.google.com/p/smarty-php/source/browse/trunk/distribution/change_log.txt?r=4902
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97725
  • http://advisories.mageia.org/MGASA-2014-0468.html
  • http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q4/420
  • http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q4/421
  • http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2014:221
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/70708
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2pmx-6mm6-6v72

entry.title: [munkireport/munki_facts] MunkiReport munki_facts module Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the munki_facts (aka Munki Conditions) module before 1.5 for MunkiReport allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the key name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15881
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munki_facts/releases
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/releases/tag/v5.6.3
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/wiki/20200722-munki_facts-XSS
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x9q4-5f3c-cw62

entry.title: [munkireport/reportdata] MunkiReport reportdata module SQL injection vulnerability
entry.content:
A SQL injection vulnerability in reportdata_controller.php in the reportdata module before 3.5 for MunkiReport allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the req parameter of the /module/reportdata/ip endpoint.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15886
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/releases
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/releases/tag/v5.6.3
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/wiki/20200722-SQL-Injection-In-Reportdata-Ip-In-'req'-GET-Parameter
  • https://github.com/munkireport/reportdata/releases
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qvw9-6567-wq78

entry.title: [munkireport/softwareupdate] MunkiReport Software Update module is vulnerable to SQL injection
entry.content:
A SQL injection vulnerability in softwareupdate_controller.php in the Software Update module before 1.6 for MunkiReport allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the last URL parameter of the /module/softwareupdate/get_tab_data/ endpoint.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15887
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/releases
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/releases/tag/v5.6.3
  • https://github.com/munkireport/munkireport-php/wiki/20200722-SQL-Injection-in-softwareupdate-module
  • https://github.com/munkireport/softwareupdate/releases
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4qgh-m9vp-48xp

entry.title: [zoujingli/thinkadmin] ThinkAdmin insecure unserialize vulnerability
entry.content:
An insecure unserialize vulnerability was discovered in ThinkAdmin versions 4.x through 6.x in app/admin/controller/api/Update.php and app/wechat/controller/api/Push.php, which may lead to arbitrary remote code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-23653
  • https://github.com/zoujingli/ThinkAdmin/issues/238
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4vp2-mj4m-69m4

entry.title: [zoujingli/thinkadmin] ThinkAdmin Admin Panel Access using Default Credentials
entry.content:
ThinkAdmin v6 has default administrator credentials, which allows attackers to gain unrestricted administratior dashboard access.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-35296
  • https://github.com/Shrimant12/CVE-References/blob/main/CVE-2020-35296.md
  • https://github.com/zoujingli/ThinkAdmin
  • https://smshrimant.com/admin-panel-access-using-default-credentials
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cxv7-6jgf-7gwf

entry.title: [zoujingli/thinkadmin] ThinkAdmin Administrator cookies still working after password change
entry.content:
application\admin\controller\User.php in ThinkAdmin V4.0 does not prevent continued use of an administrator's cookie-based credentials after a password change.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11018
  • https://github.com/zoujingli/ThinkAdmin/issues/173
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qv5j-rwq3-m823

entry.title: [fineuploader/php-traditional-server] FineUploader php-traditional-server unauthenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability
entry.content:
Unauthenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability in FineUploader php-traditional-server <= v1.2.2

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-9209
  • http://www.vapidlabs.com/advisory.php?v=208
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j78w-6r73-22vh

entry.title: [shopware/platform] Shopware database password is leaked to an unauthenticated users
entry.content:
In Shopware before 6.2.3, the database password is leaked to an unauthenticated user when a DriverException occurs and verbose error handling is enabled.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13997
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-6-en/security-updates/security-update-07-2020
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog/#6-2-3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4ph-mx67-x58p

entry.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware database password is leaked to an unauthenticated users
entry.content:
In Shopware before 6.2.3, the database password is leaked to an unauthenticated user when a DriverException occurs and verbose error handling is enabled.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13997
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-6-en/security-updates/security-update-07-2020
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog/#6-2-3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4ph-mx67-x58p

entry.title: [shopware/core] Shopware database password is leaked to an unauthenticated users
entry.content:
In Shopware before 6.2.3, the database password is leaked to an unauthenticated user when a DriverException occurs and verbose error handling is enabled.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13997
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-6-en/security-updates/security-update-07-2020

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] TeamPass Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
entry.content:
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) was discovered in TeamPass before 2.1.27.9. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient filtration of data (in /sources/folders.queries.php). An attacker could execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a browser in the context of the vulnerable website.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15278
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/TeamPass/commit/f5a765381f051fe624386866ddb1f6b5e7eb929b
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/TeamPass/blob/master/changelog.md
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/TeamPass/releases/tag/2.1.27.9
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-28pv-2j2h-fmhc

entry.title: [getgrav/grav] Grav CMS Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in system/src/Grav/Common/Twig/Twig.php in Grav CMS before 1.3.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the PATH_INFO to admin/tools.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-5233
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/03/15/1
  • https://sysdream.com/news/lab/2018-03-15-cve-2018-5233-grav-cms-admin-plugin-reflected-cross-site-scripting-xss-vulnerability
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-977g-93f5-rqjx

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] TeamPass Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format vulnerability
entry.content:
TeamPass version 2.1.27 and earlier contains a Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format vulnerability in Shared password vaults that can result in all shared passwords are recoverable server side. This attack appears to be exploitable via any vulnerability that can bypass authentication or role assignment and can lead to shared password leakage.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1000001
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/TeamPass/issues/2495
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q9qr-h33g-fw3j

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] TeamPass Improper Privilege Management
entry.content:
TeamPass before 2.1.27.9 does not properly enforce manager access control when requesting roles.queries.php. It is then possible for a manager user to modify any arbitrary roles within the application, or delete any arbitrary role. To exploit the vulnerability, an authenticated attacker must have the manager rights on the application, then tamper with the requests sent directly, for example by changing the "id" parameter when invoking "delete_role" on roles.queries.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15053
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/TeamPass/commit/ef32e9c28b6ddc33cee8a25255bc8da54434af3e
  • http://blog.amossys.fr/teampass-multiple-cve-01.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xvjf-394g-phrr
